3. Vertical section of a disk of complex type, showing
<s>its</s> commencement of its first zone by a single layer
of passages (<u>a</u> from the nucleus; the presence of two
annular canals, <s>but</s> with the absence of separation of the
superficial cells, in the <s>second</s> first zone (<u>b</u>); the incomplete
separation of the superficial cells from the intermedi-
ate columnar portion in the second zone (<u>c</u>); and the nor-
mal conformation of the remainder (<u>c</u>-<u>d</u>):- 48 diam.
4. Vertical section of a disk disk of complex type, showing

posed cells immediately around, and even partly covering,
